Project Accountant Job at Genesis Group




        
    

        
        Genesis Group is a fast-paced hospitality conglomerate with business interests in restaurants, catering, hotels, cinemas, snack food manufacturing and oil and gas support services. Running for 30 years, we pride ourselves in offering our exceptional customer experience to a significant consumer base across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Accountant
Job Location: Port Harcourt - Rivers / Owerri - Imo
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are a reputable construction company (GENTEC) seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Project Accountant to manage the financial aspects of construction projects from inception to completion.
	The role requires close collaboration with project managers, Admins, site engineers, procurement, store officers and finance teams to ensure accurate cost control, budgeting, and financial reporting across all projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and manage project budgets, cost plans, and cash flow forecasts
	Monitor project expenditures and ensure costs remain within approved budgets
	Track construction costs including materials, labour, subcontractors, and overheads
	Conduct variance analysis and provide timely financial insights to project managers
	Prepare monthly project financial reports, cost-to-complete, and profitability analysis
	Process contractor and supplier invoices, certifications, and payment schedules
	Manage project accruals, work-in-progress (WIP), and revenue recognition
	Ensure compliance with accounting standards, company policies, and contract terms
	Support internal and external audits with project financial documentation
	Liaise with site teams to validate costs and ensure accurate financial records


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: kalebaah@gmail.com or vacancies@genesisgroupng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Logistics / Warehouse Manager",
  "description": "Omenka Industries is a dynamic force in the lubricant distribution landscape, proudly serving as anauthorized distributor of TotalEnergies Lubricants.&nbsp;We are committed to powering industries, vehicles, and machinery with premium, high-performance lubricants that guarantee efficiency, protection, and longevity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics / Warehouse Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Makurdir Benue

Role Overview


	We are seeking an experienced and highly organized&nbsp;Logistics / Warehouse Manager&nbsp;to oversee&nbsp;warehouse operations, inventory control, logistics coordination, and distribution efficiencyacross our lubricants depot and delivery network.
	This role is critical to ensuring&nbsp;product availability, stock integrity, timely deliveries, and strict control of inventory, especially in our mandate as anauthorized distributorresponsible for eliminating counterfeit lubricants in the market.
	The ideal candidate is&nbsp;hands-on, process-driven, detail-oriented, and accountable, with strong leadership skills and a solid understanding of warehouse, logistics, and stock management operations.


Key Responsibilities
Warehouse &amp; Depot Operations:


	Manage day-to-day warehouse and depot activities
	Ensure proper storage, handling, and labeling of lubricants and related products
	Maintain a clean, organized, and safe warehouse environment
	Enforce standard operating procedures (SOPs) for warehouse operations


Inventory Management &amp; Control:


	Maintain accurate inventory records and stock movement logs
	Track stock receipts, issues, transfers, and balances
	Conduct regular stock counts and periodic audits
	Investigate and resolve stock variances or discrepancies
	Monitor expiry dates, batch numbers, and product integrity
	Ensure FIFO (First-In, First-Out) principles are followed


Logistics &amp; Distribution Management:


	Plan and coordinate product deliveries to customers and institutional partners
	Manage loading, dispatch, and delivery schedules
	Ensure proper documentation for all dispatches (delivery notes, waybills)
	Coordinate with drivers and third-party logistics providers where applicable
	Track deliveries and resolve delivery-related issues promptly


Fleet &amp; Equipment Oversight:


	Supervise vehicles, forklifts, and warehouse equipment
	Ensure vehicles are roadworthy and properly maintained
	Track fuel usage and basic logistics costs
	Report maintenance needs or operational risks

Logistics / Warehouse Manager Job at Omenka Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Omenka Industries is a dynamic force in the lubricant distribution landscape, proudly serving as anauthorized distributor of TotalEnergies Lubricants. We are committed to powering industries, vehicles, and machinery with premium, high-performance lubricants that guarantee efficiency, protection, and longevity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics / Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Makurdir Benue

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced and highly organized Logistics / Warehouse Manager to oversee warehouse operations, inventory control, logistics coordination, and distribution efficiencyacross our lubricants depot and delivery network.
	This role is critical to ensuring product availability, stock integrity, timely deliveries, and strict control of inventory, especially in our mandate as anauthorized distributorresponsible for eliminating counterfeit lubricants in the market.
	The ideal candidate is hands-on, process-driven, detail-oriented, and accountable, with strong leadership skills and a solid understanding of warehouse, logistics, and stock management operations.


Key Responsibilities
Warehouse & Depot Operations:


	Manage day-to-day warehouse and depot activities
	Ensure proper storage, handling, and labeling of lubricants and related products
	Maintain a clean, organized, and safe warehouse environment
	Enforce standard operating procedures (SOPs) for warehouse operations


Inventory Management & Control:


	Maintain accurate inventory records and stock movement logs
	Track stock receipts, issues, transfers, and balances
	Conduct regular stock counts and periodic audits
	Investigate and resolve stock variances or discrepancies
	Monitor expiry dates, batch numbers, and product integrity
	Ensure FIFO (First-In, First-Out) principles are followed


Logistics & Distribution Management:


	Plan and coordinate product deliveries to customers and institutional partners
	Manage loading, dispatch, and delivery schedules
	Ensure proper documentation for all dispatches (delivery notes, waybills)
	Coordinate with drivers and third-party logistics providers where applicable
	Track deliveries and resolve delivery-related issues promptly


Fleet & Equipment Oversight:


	Supervise vehicles, forklifts, and warehouse equipment
	Ensure vehicles are roadworthy and properly maintained
	Track fuel usage and basic logistics costs
	Report maintenance needs or operational risks


Compliance, Safety & Security:


	Ensure compliance with company policies, safety standards, and regulatory requirements
	Implement safety procedures for handling petroleum products
	Enforce access control and security protocols within the warehouse
	Ensure proper documentation for audits and inspections


Team Supervision & Reporting:


	Supervise warehouse assistants, loaders, and drivers
	Assign duties, monitor performance, and enforce discipline
	Train staff on inventory handling, safety, and SOPs
	Prepare and submit regular operational and inventory reports


Required Skills & Qualifications
Education & Experience:


	HND / Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field with 3–5 years of experience in warehouse and logistics management
	Experience in lubricants, FMCG, oil & gas distribution, or industrial supplies is a strong advantage


Core Competencies:


	Strong inventory management and stock control skills
	Excellent organizational and planning ability
	Leadership and people-management skills
	High attention to detail and accountability
	Ability to work under pressure and meet delivery timelines


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and inventory tracking tools
	Familiarity with warehouse management systems (WMS) or ERP tools (an advantage)
	Ability to prepare accurate reports and documentation


Personal Attributes:


	Honest, disciplined, and dependable
	Proactive and solutions-oriented
	Physically fit and willing to be hands-on when required
	Strong sense of responsibility and ownership


Why Join Omenka Industries Limited?


	Be part of a fast-growing authorized distribution company
	Play a key role in protecting the market from counterfeit lubricants
	Opportunity to grow into senior operations leadership
	Stable, structured, and performance-driven work environment


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV and brief Cover Letter outlining relevant experience to: info@omenkalube.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
